description.narrative: The stabilization project aims to support stability and peace building by strengthening the resilience of communities which are at a higher risk of being drawn into conflict.

participating-org.narrative: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS & COOPERATION OF SPAIN

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

1.1. 4555 youth supported with livelihoods in farming, vocational skills training and small businesses for self/wage employment. 1.2. 15% of those who receive assistance in 2020 are linked to microcredits and value chains. 2.1. 26 infrastructure/economic assets delivered (i.e. 25 tractors and implements, 1 water infrastructure water infrastructure). 2.2. 28 community management committees (CMCs) established to manage projects. 2.3. 7,800 seasonable jobs provided for young men and women of this total)
3.1. 28 CMCs and peacebuilding sub-committees established and trained accordingly
3.2. 28 gender-focused projects (REFLECT training) implemented. 3.3.1. 2 (two) awareness initiative and sensitization session conducted 3.3.2. 1 (one) cross border initiative – 100% achieved. 4.1. 2 institutions identified and provided with capacity building training to implement project 4.2. 28 NGOs/CBOs contracted via completive process and provided with capacity building training to implement project – . 5.1. 12 visits (Project Field Officer, M&E officer, etc.) from headquarter (Khartoum) and field 5.2. 1 (one) board meeting held and minutes generated 5.3. 1 (one) annual report generated per donor 5.4 Key field and headquarter staff, basic ICT, communications and operations support to project implementation

Output 1: Alternative livelihoods support and vocational training for female and male at-risk youth and selected community members provided Target 1.1. Additional 950 youth/at risk groups receive assistance in various livelihood options. 1.2. Additional 20% (190) of targeted youth/at risk groups linked to micro-financing, value chains, business development services, etc
Output 2: Social and economic infrastructure, assets or basic facilities in support of economic recovery and conflict mitigation established. Targets
2.1. 1 primary school for girls constructed and equipped with solar lighting system. 2.2 At least 3 agricultural irrigation schemes rehabilitated, 10 tractors and implements purchased and delivered, 2 water yards constructed for integrated farming, 2 hafeer rehabilitated, 10 tricycles provided, 2.3 At least 20 Community Management Committee established and functional. 2.4 At least 3500 additional men and women engaged in short term jobs through rehabilitation of agricultural irrigation canals rehabilitation
Output 3: Capacity of local community members and institutions to carry out peace building activities, control small arms proliferation, engage in Natural resource Managemnet and prevent gender related local conflict in communities strengthened: Targets 3.1.: At least additional 20 Community Management Committee established, up and running. 3.2.: At least additional 18 women empowerment projects delivered. 3.3. At least additional 20 awareness initiatives and sensitization sessions conducted on Small Arms and Light Weapons and other peacebuilding and social cohesion related activities. 3.3.2. At least additional 4 cross border initiative.
Output 4: Capacity development of Government and local service providers to deliver services strengthened. Targets 4.1. At least additional 15 institutions engaged and trained on project 4.2. At least additional 20 Non Governmental Organizations /Community Based Organizations contracted
Output 5: Project Management, for input mobilization including logistics support and evaluation.
Targets
5.1. At most additional 1 mid-term evaluation. 5.2 At least additional 1 project board meeting organized. 5.3 At least 6 reports (progress reports, annual report, perception survey report on project achievement, etc.). 5.4 At least additional 2 staff 5.5 At least additional 6 vehicles 5.6 At least additional 40 Information Communication and Technology equipment (30 laptops and 10 desktops).

Output 1: Alternative livelihoods support and vocational training for female and male at-risk youth and selected community members provided Target
1.1. 100% achieved.
1.2. 15% of those who received assistance were linked to private sector actors.
Output 2: Social and economic infrastructure, assets or basic facilities in support of economic recovery and conflict mitigation established. Targets
2.1. 100% achieved
2.2 4 agricultural irrigation schemes rehabilitated. 10 tractors and implements including 10 harvesting machines delivered to 10 communities. 2 water yards constructed up and running. 10 tricycles delivered to targeted communities.
2.3 20 CMCs and peacebuilding established and members provided with capacity building trainings.
2.4 4000 seasonal jobs created for displaced population and host community members in the field of agriculture.
Output 3: Capacity of local community members and institutions to carry out peace building activities, control small arms proliferation, engage in Natural resource Managemnet and prevent gender related local conflict in communities strengthened: Targets
3.1: 20 community management committees established, members provided with capacity building trainings.
3.2.: 20 women empowerment projects delivered in the area of grinding mill, tailoring and clothing repair, festival equipment rental, small ruminant restocking.
3.3. 100% achieved.
3.3.2. One cross boarder initiated achieved. The rest not done due to civil on rest country-wide.
Output 4: Capacity development of Government and local service providers to deliver services strengthened. Targets
4.1. 100% achieved
4.2. 90% achieved (18 NGOs)
Output 5: Project Management, for input mobilization including logistics support and evaluation.

Output 2: Statement: Socio-economic infrastructure, economic assets and basic facilities in support of economic recovery and conflict mitigation established.
2.1: 25 socio-economic infrastructure or assets projects implemented in the target communities 2.2: 25 committees established in the target locations 2.3: 5,000 women and men engaged in short term jobs through the infrastructure/seasonal employment
Output 3: Statement: Access to renewable energy enhanced in communities hosting displaced population while protecting the environment.
1.1: at least 400 households reached with solar stoves for household meal preparation 1.2: at least 200 farmers with access to solar pumps for small scale farming. 1.3: at least 10 community facilities equipped with solar energy 1.4: at least 10 communities/settlements with equipped with streetlights.
Output 4: Capacity of local community members and institutions to carry out peacebuilding activities, control small arms proliferation, engage in NRM and prevent gender related local conflict in communities strengthened.
4.1: 25 community management committees or other mechanisms to support small arms control and natural resource management implemented in the target communities 4.2: 25 specialized gender projects such as, women’s empowerment, SGBV and other forms of gender-based violence 4.3: 4 SALW control and community security sensitization initiatives undertaken by the target communities. 4.4: 25 cross border initiatives in support of community security, peace building and small arms control. 4.5: 25 civil society organization receiving capacity building trainings
5: Support to project implementation.
5.1: 12 Number of M&E visits conducted. 5.2. 1 project board meeting conducted. 5.3. 1 report drafted and endorsed with stakeholders.
5.4 Staffing, ICT, communication and operations support.
